comment: Super easy class! Do what your suppose to do and easy A. I got 100 on every assignment. we got to use Pinterest boards for assignments and the final is a scavenger hunt at Barnes n noble. Would defintley recommend taking Dr. Hubbard!
Excellent. Enthusiastic, knowledgeable, super organized. Would highly recommend.

Super super easy. I took her during the summer and it was a very laid back experience. I was able to soak in the material at my own pace, and going to class was a blast, and that is saying something for a summer semester at 8am.
This was a hybrid class, meeting only one day a week. Dr. Hubbard is super sweet, and a really good teacher. Her class was a lot of fun, and her assignments are really easy.
She was not a very good teacher and she seemed focused on other things instead of teaching. Hope she get better over time.

Dr. Hubbard is my favorite professor by far! She is very understanding, creative and an inspirational professor! I was actually excited to go to her class- take her if you can! Not a difficult class either- just a presentation and minimal reading.

She is a very kind person, but her teaching style is highly problematic. You don't learn how to teach content reading in her class; instead, you make a lesson plan you'll never use in your classroom. The class is, unfortunately, a waste of time and energy. Oh, get used to graphic organizers - every. single. day.

If you have a chance to take her you should! She is one of my favorite teachers at KSU. I took this class as a hybri and it was once a week every other week which is awesome! 15 hours of field experience....TAKE HER!
Take her if you have the opportunity. She is very understanding and keeps herself open for guidance. I learned so much from her. Great teacher!!

Fall 2010 was Dr. Hubbard's fist semester here. She did not know much about the expectations of the course or anything about chalk and wire but she learned quickly.. Every other week she would allow us to observe instead of come to class. We didn't use the textbook hardly at all, and due dates and assignments were clearly outlined.
